column5: These worldviews are like two perceptions of the same figure, say a visual illusion like a Necker Cube. Perception can flick either way once both perceptions have been experienced. This requires fully appreciating the features of each worldview. Then conscious choice is possible.

In the case of information war, however, narratives are deliberately constructed by the antagonists and adopted unconsciously by target audiences. When two antagonists are projecting two competing narratives of reality, the population will polarize into two distinct worldviews.

Strategic perception at a time of information war faces a difficulty. Narratives are often used for organizing cognition of otherwise incoherent events. Usually it is assumed that there are no “naturally existing” narratives, and that they are invented for sense making purposes.

Brilliant stuff – wormholes and entanglement shown to be the same thing by using a quantum computer to act like a set of black holes, relating them using a simplified neural network to cope with the current primitive state of quantum computers. Wow!
